thread.title: Utes' Kyle Whittingham No. 40, USU's Matt Wells No. 84 in USA Today's football coach salary rankings
thread.title_full: Utes' Kyle Whittingham No. 40, USU's Matt Wells No. 84 in USA Today's football coach salary rankings | Deseret News

title: Utes' Kyle Whittingham No. 40, USU's Matt Wells No. 84 in USA Today's football coach salary rankings
text:
USA Today released rankings of the highest-paid college football head coaches in the land on Thursday morning.
Upcoming Games Utah Football Utah football stats & schedule Cal @ Utah Rice-Eccles Stadium, Salt Lake City Oct. 10, 8:00 p.m. 2 Days 0 Hrs 12 Mins 35 Secs USU Football USU football stats & schedule USU @ Fresno State Bulldog Stadium, Fresno Oct. 10, 8:30 p.m. 2 Days 0 Hrs 42 Mins 56 Secs More Coverage Corso and headgear and signs, oh, my: How-to guide to ESPN's 'College GameDay' Guarding a gunslinger: Utes set to face California star quarterback Jared Goff Morning links: ESPN takes deep dive into Utah football; Cal's Jared Goff 'Big Man on Campus'; Jimmer Fredette featured Want drama? Storylines galore? Look at college QBs in state of Utah USA Today released a list of Division I football head coaches ranked by their per year salaries Thursday, and there were no surprises who tops the list.
Alabama’s Nick Saban is football royalty in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, and besides Michigan’s Jim Harbaugh ($7,004,000), he makes the most out of any head coach in America by more than $1 million at $7,087,481.
Thirty-nine spots lower at No. 40, you’ll find Utah head coach Kyle Whittingham, who will rake in $2.6 million from the U. this season. When comparing Whittingham to his counterparts, his salary sits at No. 7 out of the 11 Pac-12 schools surveyed (USC is private school), a statistic that might change in the coming years if the Utes can continue this early season success.
To put everything in perspective, there are 12 SEC head coaches, five Big Ten, five Big 12 coaches and one ACC coach who make more than the highest-paid Pac-12 coach (Washington’s Chris Petersen). Meanwhile, every coach in the SEC whose numbers are available (Vanderbilt is private) makes more than Whittingham, who has his Utah team sitting at No. 5 in The Associated Press Poll.
If you’re looking for BYU head coach Bronco Mendenhall’s salary, you won’t find it on this list. Due to BYU being a private institution, those records were not readily available for USA Today.
Utah State head coach Matt Wells comes in at No. 84 on the list, the eighth-highest salary in the Mountain West, at $750,000.
